de.dennis_kempf.squidward

Interface Transition<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - event type that triggers this transition
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImmutableTransition

    public interface Transition<T>
    Transition from one State of an Automaton to another.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Transition.Action<T>
      Action which will be executed if an transaction is taken.
      static interface  Transition.Guard<T>
      Guard which has to be satisfied for an transition to be taken.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default java.util.Optional<Transition.Action<T>> getAction()
      Returns optional action that will be executed if this transition is taken.
      State getDestinationState()
      Returns the destination state.
      java.lang.Class<T> getEventType()
      Returns the type of events that may trigger this transition.
      default java.util.Optional<Transition.Guard<T>> getGuard()
      Returns optional guard that must be satisfied for this transition to be taken.
      State getSourceState()
      Returns the source state.

    • Method Detail

      • getSourceState

        State getSourceState()
        Returns the source state. The transition can only be taken if the source state matches the current state of the automaton.
        Returns:
        source state

      • getDestinationState

        State getDestinationState()
        Returns the destination state. If the transition is taken, the current state of the automaton will be set to the destination state.
        Returns:
        destination state

      • getEventType

        java.lang.Class<T> getEventType()
        Returns the type of events that may trigger this transition. Any event which is an instance of this type may trigger the transition.
        Returns:
        event type

      • getGuard

        default java.util.Optional<Transition.Guard<T>> getGuard()
        Returns optional guard that must be satisfied for this transition to be taken.
        Returns:
        optional guard

      • getAction

        default java.util.Optional<Transition.Action<T>> getAction()
        Returns optional action that will be executed if this transition is taken. The action will be called after the current state is left but before the destination state is entered. Thus the current state will be undefined during the execution of this action.
        Returns:
        optional action
